LanguageData.Squirrel.label: squirrel
LanguageData.Squirrel.description: One of the many hardy rodent species that follows humankind everywhere it spreads. Squirrels are distinguished by their bushy tails, which they use as umbrellas in bad weather.
LanguageData.Squirrel.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Squirrel.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Squirrel.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Squirrel.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Squirrel.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.label: alphabeaver
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.description: A large beaver-like creature genetically engineered to harvest wood with machine-like efficiency. In the absence of specialized feed, these animals will enter a manic state that compels them to eat trees whole, and are likely to attack if disturbed.
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Alphabeaver.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Alphabeaver.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Alphabeaver.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Capybara.label: capybara
LanguageData.Capybara.description: The largest natural rodent, the capybara is well-adapted for steaming jungle environments.
LanguageData.Capybara.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Capybara.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Capybara.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Capybara.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Capybara.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Chinchilla.label: chinchilla
LanguageData.Chinchilla.description: A small, nimble rodent. Its fur is softer than just about anything in the universe, making it very valuable as a trade good.
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Chinchilla.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Chinchilla.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Chinchilla.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Boomrat.label: boomrat
LanguageData.Boomrat.description: Either by deliberate genetic weaponization, or as an unusual defense mechanism, these rodent-like creatures create a powerful fire-starting explosion when killed.
LanguageData.Boomrat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Boomrat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Boomrat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Boomrat.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Boomrat.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Raccoon.label: raccoon
LanguageData.Raccoon.description: A small, hardy animal that ranges wide across forests and shrubland. It is happy to break into your garbage container, or your kitchen, to eat almost anything.
LanguageData.Raccoon.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Raccoon.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Raccoon.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Raccoon.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Raccoon.label: CorpseLabel
LanguageData.Rat.label: rat
LanguageData.Rat.description: A widely-hated rodent known for soiling kitchens and spreading disease, rats have a way of following humans everywhere they go. It eats almost anything and lives almost anywhere.
LanguageData.Rat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Rat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Rat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Meat_Rat.label: MeatLabel
LanguageData.Corpse_Rat.label: CorpseLabel
